instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the classification of sugar beet varieties?
Output: In the classification of sugar beet varieties,the researchers used visible spectrum and nir spectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the classification of sugar beet varieties?
Output: Spectral feature extraction and feature band selection methods were used in the classification of sugar beet varieties.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the recognition performance in the classification of sugar beet varieties and how far can this metric go?
Output: The recognition rate was chosen as the metric to evaluate the recognition performance in the classification of sugar beet varieties, and it achieved up to 95.45% in the prediction set.

instruction: What were the results of comparing the recognition accuracy of ELM models established based on all bands and feature bands extracted using the standard deviation peak method in the classification of sugar beet varieties using hyperspectral technology and the ELM algorithm?
Output:
The results of comparing the recognition accuracy of ELM models established based on all bands and feature bands extracted using the standard deviation peak method in the classification of sugar beet varieties using hyperspectral technology and the ELM algorithm were as follows:

- The recognition accuracy of the ELM models established based on the feature bands was better than that established based on all bands.
- The combination of different pretreatment methods and the first derivative (FD) effectively improved the signal-to-noise ratio and enhanced the accuracy and stability of spectral models.
- Based on the SG-FD pretreatment method, the ELM models established using all bands and feature bands both achieved high recognition effects.
- The recognition rates of the prediction sets were 93.94% for the ELM model established based on all bands and 95.45% for the ELM model established based on feature bands.

instruction: Can the combination of different pretreatment methods and the FD method effectively improve the signal-to-noise ratio and enhance the accuracy and stability of spectral models in the classification of sugar beet varieties using hyperspectral technology and the ELM algorithm?
Output: Yes, the combination of different pretreatment methods and the FD method can effectively improve the signal-to-noise ratio and enhance the accuracy and stability of spectral models in the classification of sugar beet varieties using hyperspectral technology and the ELM algorithm. The experimental results showed that the recognition rates of sugar beet varieties by ELM models were all over 80% for different pretreatment methods. Additionally, the combination of different pretreatment methods and FD effectively improved the signal-to-noise ratio and enhanced the accuracy and stability of spectral models. Based on the SG-FD pretreatment method, the ELM models established using all bands and feature bands both achieved the highest recognition effect, with recognition rates of 93.94% and 95.45% respectively for the prediction sets.
